prompt: Facts: Marriage solemnized between Arnesh Kumar (Appellant) and Sweta Kiran (Respondent No. 2) on July 1, 2007.; Sweta Kiran alleged demands for dowry (Rs. 8 Lakhs, Maruti Car, AC, TV etc.) by Arnesh Kumar and his family (father, mother, sisters).; Sweta Kiran alleged she was driven out of the matrimonial home due to non-fulfillment of dowry demands.; An FIR (No. 197/2007) was registered on behalf of Sweta Kiran at Mahila Thana, Patna, Bihar.; The FIR was registered under Sections 498A, 406 of the Indian Penal Code (IPC) and Section 4 of the Dowry Prohibition Act, 1961.; Arnesh Kumar apprehended arrest following the registration of the FIR.; Arnesh Kumar filed an application for anticipatory bail under Section 438 of the Code of Criminal Procedure (CrPC) before the Sessions Judge, Patna.; The Sessions Judge rejected the anticipatory bail application.; Arnesh Kumar filed a Criminal Miscellaneous application (No. 16097 of 2008) before the High Court of Judicature at Patna seeking anticipatory bail.; The High Court dismissed the application on November 9, 2010.; Arnesh Kumar filed a Special Leave Petition (later converted to Criminal Appeal No. 1277 of 2014) before the Supreme Court of India, challenging the High Court's order and seeking protection from arrest.; The Supreme Court noted the widespread phenomenon of arrests under Section 498A IPC and examined the scope and necessity of arrest under Section 41 CrPC, particularly for offenses punishable with imprisonment up to seven years. | IPC: Section 498A (Husband or relative of husband of a woman subjecting her to cruelty), Section 406 (Punishment for criminal breach of trust), Section 4 of the Dowry Prohibition Act, 1961 (Penalty for demanding dowry) - *Note: This is not IPC but was part of the FIR*, Section 41 CrPC (When police may arrest without warrant) - *Note: Procedural section heavily discussed*, Section 41A CrPC (Notice of appearance before police officer) - *Note: Procedural section heavily discussed*
